intro: Goniophlebium attenuatum, commonly known as the slender fern, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided leaves that give it a lacy appearance. Native to parts of Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by red berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
